notes.text: An update for tcpdump is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
The tcpdump packages contain the tcpdump utility for monitoring network traffic. The tcpdump utility can capture and display the packet headers on a particular network interface or on all interfaces.

For detailed information on changes in this release, see the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.5 Release Notes linked from the References section.

Users of tcpdump are advised to upgrade to these updated packages.

notes.text: tcpdump 4.9.0 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer over-read and application crash) via crafted packet data. The crash occurs in the EXTRACT_16BITS function, called from the stp_print function for the Spanning Tree Protocol.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2017-11108 tcpdump: Heap buffer overflow in the EXTRACT_16BITS function
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2017-11108 tcpdump: Heap buffer overflow in the EXTRACT_16BITS function

notes.text: A vulnerability was discovered in tcpdump's handling of LINKTYPE_SLIP pcap files. An attacker could craft a malicious pcap file that would cause tcpdump to crash when attempting to print a summary of packet data within the file.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2017-11543 tcpdump: buffer overflow in the sliplink_print function
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Red Hat Product Security has rated this issue as having Low security impact. This issue is not currently planned to be addressed in future updates. For additional information, refer to the Issue Severity Classification: https://access.redhat.com/security/updates/classification/.

cwe.name: Buffer Copy without Checking Size of Input ('Classic Buffer Overflow')

notes.text: A vulnerability was found in tcpdump's verbose printing of packet data. A crafted pcap file or specially crafted network traffic could cause tcpdump to write out of bounds in the BSS segment, potentially causing tcpdump to display truncated or incorrectly decoded fields or crash with a segmentation violation. This does not affect tcpdump when used with the -w option to save a pcap file.
notes.title: Vulnerability description
